org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.jms
Class JMSReadConnector

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.jms.JMSReadConnector
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, javax.jms.ExceptionListener, IComponent, IReadConnector, ITransactional
public class JMSReadConnector
extends Component
implements javax.jms.ExceptionListener, IReadConnector, ITransactional

Read Connector class that implements listening to JMS.

Manages a single JMS Session and MessageConsumer.

Delegates to JMSConnector to get the actual Connection with JMS.

Main Properties

  • destinationName Name used to look up destination (queue/topic) in JNDI
  • acknowledgeMode Defaults to Session.AUTO_ACKNOWLEDGE
  • transacted If true then a transacted session is acquired and a TransactionalResource created even if XA resources are available.
  • durable Defaults to false. If true create a durable topic subscription.
  • durableSubscriptionName Defaults to the destinationName. The name used to create the durable topic subscription.
  • messageSelector Not set by default.
  • noLocal Default is false

Author:
OA3 Core Team
See Also:
JMSConnection

Method Detail

connect

public void connect()
Description copied from interface: IReadConnector
This should be called before IReadConnector.next(long) is called. Implementations should use this method to establish connections to external resources and prepare to accept calls to IReadConnector.next(long). Exceptions should be thrown as RuntimeExceptions. If the implementation is an IComponent then it should throw ConnectionException.

Specified by:
connect in interface IReadConnector

disconnect

public void disconnect()
Description copied from interface: IReadConnector
This should be called before the implementation is unreferenced. Implementations should use this method to "cleanup" connections to external resources and reset state. Exceptions should be thrown as RuntimeExceptions. If the implementation is an IComponent then it should throw ConnectionException.

Specified by:
disconnect in interface IReadConnector

validate

public void validate(java.util.List exceptions)
Description copied from interface: IReadConnector
This method checks that the current state of an implementation is "meaningful". Implementations of IReadConnector are typically beans with zero-arg constructors. Implementations are encouraged to add exception to the list parameter rather than throwing them. This allows the calling code to collate the exceptions. If the implementation is an IComponent then the exceptions should be a ValidationException.

Specified by:
validate in interface IReadConnector
Parameters:
exceptions - collection to which exceptions should be added

isDry

public boolean isDry()
Description copied from interface: IReadConnector
Used to establish whether there is any more data to process. The run implementation of ReadNode returns when this method returns true. The behaviour of the implementation is very much dependent of type of external resource that implementation "talks to", it should only return true if there will never be any more data available, this is different from the scenario where there is is no data at the moment but there maybe in future. The documentation for each implementation should state its specific behaviour.

Specified by:
isDry in interface IReadConnector
Returns:
true if no more data is available from the external rsource.

getResource

public java.lang.Object getResource()
Description copied from interface: ITransactional
If the implementation wants to take part in the current transaction then it should either return an instance of ITransactionalResource or and instance of XAResource. It is assumed that the configured transaction manager that creates the actual transaction will match type of resource return. Return null if the component is not configured to be transactional.

Specified by:
getResource in interface ITransactional
Returns:
the output
